messages.original: Zaporizhzhia City
More from Zaporizhzhia. A large fire is burning at the impact sites.
More from Zaporizhzhia. A large fire is burning at the impact sites.

Last night, a large-scale Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Odesa Oblast. At least 26 drones attacked targets in Nerubaiske, Dachne, and Odesa City.  At least 14 impacts were recorded in Nerubaiske and Dachne, along with at least 2 others within‚Ä¶
NASA FIRMS data shows that a fire is burning at the Nova Poshta terminal.

Over the past 2 hours, 4 Russian Iskander-M ballistic missiles have been launched from three directions, targeting:  Oleksandrivka, Donetsk Oblast. Kharkiv City, Kharkiv Oblast. Sumy City, Sumy Oblast. Pavlohrad, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.

Footage showing last night's Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile strike near Novodonetske, Donetsk Oblast. The missile - equipped with a cluster warhead - targeted a distribution point for FPV drones and ammunition.
Coordinates
: 48.6616033, 36.9760846

Last night, a combined missile and drone attack was carried out on Sumy Oblast. 1 Iskander-M ballistic missile and at least 8 Geran-2 drones attacked targets in the region.
The Iskander-M impacted a building newly used by the SBU and Sumy Regional Governor in Sumy City. Naturally, we didn't get any photos or videos from here.
Additionally, 4+ Geran-2 drones impacted a school in Sumy. At least 2 other impacts were also recorded at a "non-residential building" in the city of Shostka. All photos and videos are from the school in Sumy. No civilians were killed or injured.

Last night, a combined missile and drone attack was carried out on Sumy Oblast. 1 Iskander-M ballistic missile and at least 8 Geran-2 drones attacked targets in the region.
The Iskander-M impacted a building newly used by the SBU and Sumy Regional Governor in Sumy City. Naturally, we didn't get any photos or videos from here.
Additionally, 4+ Geran-2 drones impacted a school in Sumy. At least 2 other impacts were also recorded at a "non-residential building" in the city of Shostka. All photos and videos are from the school in Sumy. No civilians were killed or injured.

Last night, another massive Russian Geran-2 drone attack was carried out on Donetsk Oblast, possibly even the largest since the beginning of the war.
At least 39 drones attacked the settlements of Dobropillya, Bilozerske, Slovyansk, Novodonetske, Novoyavlenka, Vesela Hora, Shostakivka, Oleksandrivka, Samars'ke, and Druzhkivka.
Almost all of them impacted, with air defence activity only taking place in Slovyansk, Oleksandrivka, and Novodonetske. The majority of the strikes occurred in western Donetsk Oblast, while 6+ others struck targets in Druzhkivka and Slovyansk.
Additionally, as I've already reported, 1 Iskander-M ballistic missile impacted a distribution point for FPV drones and ammunition for the AFU.

Here's a map showing the settlements in Donetsk Oblast that we know were targeted.
More from Zaporizhzhia. A large fire is burning at the impact sites.

The two Iskanders impacted a commercial building in Zaporizhzhia City, rather than the Motor Sich Plant. Secondary detonations were heard right after the impacts. 
Coordinates: 47.874154, 35.048445

Advances in a war of attrition aren't linear.

The Ukrainian General Staff stated that Ukrainian UAVs attacked the Nikskoe oil pumping station near Novonikolskoe, Tambov Oblast, last night. 
NASA FIRMS data shows that a large fire has broken out, and the general staff reports that oil pumping through the Druzhba pipeline has been halted. 
Coordinates: 52.804486, 40.367500
Last night, Ukrainian UAVs attacked Donetsk City. At least three impacts were recorded to a boarding school at 47.955690, 37.791983, where a fire subsequently broke out.

Druze In Syria Demand Right Of Self Determination 
Hundreds of Druze demonstrated in the city of al-Suwayda and other parts of the southern Syrian governorate on August 16 to demand the right to self determination.
Some of the protesters waved Israeli flags to thank Israel for intervening on their side during the battle with the forces of Syria‚Äôs Islamist-led interim government and affiliated Bedouin tribes last month.
The protesters in al-Suwayda expressed their rejection of the interim government and demanded that those responsible for atrocities against Druze be brought to justice. Some of the protesters called on Israel to intervene to support their demand of self determination.
Read more 
HERE

Military Situation In Ukraine On August 17, 2025 (Maps Update)
Military Situation In Ukraine On August 17, 2025 (Maps Update)

Fresh Russian Strikes Hit Ukraine‚Äôs Sapsan Missile Program
Russian strikes hit a site where Ukraine stored Sapsan tactical ballistic missiles, the Russian Ministry of Defense announced on August 17, just a few days after the country‚Äôs Federal Security Service (FSB) revealed an operation that stalled a plan by Kiev to mass produce the system.
The Sapsan, also known as Hirm and Grom, is believed to have a maximum range of 700 kilometers and a warhead weighing 480 kg.
‚ÄúOperational/tactical aircraft, attack unmanned aerial vehicles, missile troops and artillery of the Russian groups of forces struck a storage site of Sapsan theater-level missiles and their parts, ammunition depots and warehouses of long-range unmanned aerial vehicles and temporary deployment areas of Ukrainian armed formations and foreign mercenaries in 142 locations,‚Äù the ministry said in its daily briefing.
Read more 
HERE

Kyiv‚Äôs Nuclear Provocation: Ukrainian Drone Targets Smolensk Nuclear Power Plant
In yet another reckless act of nuclear terrorism, the Kyiv regime attempted to strike the Smolensk Nuclear Power Plant (NPP) in Russian rear using an attack drone. According to the Russian Federal Security Service (FSB), the Ukrainian unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) was successfully intercepted and neutralized by electronic warfare systems before it could cause any damage.
On the night of August 17, Russian air defense and electronic warfare units detected and suppressed a Ukrainian-made Spis attack drone flying over the Smolensk NPP. The FSB released images of the wreckage, confirming the UAV‚Äôs origin. The drone, which was likely on a reconnaissance or test run before a larger-scale attack, was disabled mid-flight and crashed without causing any casualties or significant infrastructure damage.
Read more 
HERE

Syrian Army Is Planning To Attack Kurdish Forces With 50,000 Troops
The Syrian military is planning a large-scale attack with some 50,000 troops on the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) to capture the governorates of Raqqa and Deir Ezzor in the north and east of the country, The National reported on August 16, citing security sources.
According to the sources, the attack will be launched if the SDF, which is backed by the United States, refuses to hand over control over the two governorates, which have overwhelmingly Arab tribal populations...

HERE

Russia Thwarted Another Kyiv‚Äôs Terrorist Attack On Crimean Bridge
On August 18, the Russian Federal Security Service (FSB) reported that another Kyiv‚Äôs terrorist attack was successfully thwarted. The recent interception of a rigged Chevrolet Volt electric vehicle bound for the Crimean Bridge has exposed yet another desperate attempt by Ukrainian special services to strike at Russia‚Äôs critical infrastructure. FSB operatives stopped the car before it could reach its target, preventing what could have been a deadly terrorist attack designed for maximum media impact rather than structural destruction. The 130 kg of explosives hidden inside the vehicle‚Äôs lithium battery pack would not have destroyed the bridge entirely but would have certainly killed civilians, damaged a section of the span, and created a propaganda spectacle for Kyiv...

HERE

Iranian Commander Warns War With Israel Could Break Out At Any Time
Yahya Rahim Safavi, a senior commander of Iran‚Äôs Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps and a close adviser to Supreme Leader Ali Khamenei, warned on August 17 that another war with Israel or the United States could begin at any time.
Israel launched a surprise attack against Iran on June 13, stating that its goal was to cripple the Islamic Republic‚Äôs nuclear program. The war ended when a ceasefire was suddenly announced on June 24, just two days after the U.S. joined Israel by attacking three key nuclear sites in Iran...
